title: Ukraine & Russia trade charges over Nuclear plant fire
Putin: Kyiv incursion a bid to stop our offensive but we will carry on
content: Ukraine launched its largest attack on Russian territory since the war's onset, trying to improve its negotiating position and halt Russian advances. President Vladimir Putin stated that Ukraine, aided by Western allies, aimed to negotiate from a stronger position. Ukrainian forces controlled parts of the Kursk region, causing substantial civilian evacuations.
summary: Ukraine launched its largest attack on Russian territory since the war's onset, trying to improve its negotiating position and halt Russian advances. President Vladimir Putin stated that Ukraine, aided by Western allies, aimed to negotiate from a stronger position. Ukrainian forces controlled parts of the Kursk region, causing substantial civilian evacuations.

title: 'He's back' trends on X after Trump makes comeback
US school worker gets 9 years imprisonment for $1.5 million chicken wing heist
'Monster is gone': Bangladesh interim govt chief Yunus hails 'student-led revolution'
content: Mohammed Yunus, Nobel laureate and interim government chief of Bangladesh, praised a student-led revolution that led to the collapse of government machinery. The protests, addressing preferential quotas in government jobs, resulted in Sheikh Hasina fleeing to India. Yunus acknowledged the challenges faced by the interim government following the violent clashes between authorities and students, which caused significant turmoil.
summary: Mohammed Yunus, Nobel laureate and interim government chief of Bangladesh, praised a student-led revolution that led to the collapse of government machinery. The protests, addressing preferential quotas in government jobs, resulted in Sheikh Hasina fleeing to India. Yunus acknowledged the challenges faced by the interim government following the violent clashes between authorities and students, which caused significant turmoil.

title: AI AI yo! Trump meltdown over crowd size raises fears of mental decline
content: Concerns about Donald Trump's mental state escalated after he accused Kamala Harris of using AI to create fake crowd photos at her rallies. Trump demanded Harris' disqualification, calling it election interference. Republican and independent attendees refuted his claims by sharing real crowd footage. This incident has raised fears of Trump contesting future defeats similarly.
summary: Concerns about Donald Trump's mental state escalated after he accused Kamala Harris of using AI to create fake crowd photos at her rallies. Trump demanded Harris' disqualification, calling it election interference. Republican and independent attendees refuted his claims by sharing real crowd footage. This incident has raised fears of Trump contesting future defeats similarly.

title: How billions in dollar, euro notes are entering Russia despite strict global sanctions: Report
content: Since the 2022 export prohibition of US and EU banknotes to Russia, about $2.3 billion in dollars and euros were still sent to Russia, indicating ways to bypass sanctions. Data revealed cash shipments primarily from the UAE and Turkey. Despite Moscow's attempts to reduce reliance on hard currencies, foreign cash remains crucial for trade, travel, and savings for many Russians.
summary: Since the 2022 export prohibition of US and EU banknotes to Russia, about $2.3 billion in dollars and euros were still sent to Russia, indicating ways to bypass sanctions. Data revealed cash shipments primarily from the UAE and Turkey. Despite Moscow's attempts to reduce reliance on hard currencies, foreign cash remains crucial for trade, travel, and savings for many Russians.

title: Beggar or tourist? Travellers to Gulf under strict scrutiny at airports in Pakistan
content: Pakistani authorities increased airport scrutiny due to a rise in beggars posing as tourists traveling to the Middle East. Reports indicated that 90% of detained beggars abroad were of Pakistani origin. Immigration staff have removed passengers from flights, while UAE authorities have begun rejecting visa applications from Pakistanis without sufficient funds to be deemed 'genuine visitors.'
summary: Pakistani authorities increased airport scrutiny due to a rise in beggars posing as tourists traveling to the Middle East. Reports indicated that 90% of detained beggars abroad were of Pakistani origin. Immigration staff have removed passengers from flights, while UAE authorities have begun rejecting visa applications from Pakistanis without sufficient funds to be deemed 'genuine visitors.'

title: Will try to bring back Sheikh Hasina if ... : Bangladesh interim government
content: Bangladesh's interim government vowed to repatriate former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina if requested by the law ministry. Foreign affairs adviser Touhid Hossain highlighted the need for good relations with India and emphasized balanced international relations. He also mentioned plans for a fair future election under Nobel laureate Mohammed Yunus's leadership.
summary: Bangladesh's interim government vowed to repatriate former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina if requested by the law ministry. Foreign affairs adviser Touhid Hossain highlighted the need for good relations with India and emphasized balanced international relations. He also mentioned plans for a fair future election under Nobel laureate Mohammed Yunus's leadership.

title: Kenya cult leader on trial for manslaughter over mass deaths
content: The leader of a Kenyan starvation sect, Paul Nthenge Mackenzie, went on trial for manslaughter over the deaths of over 400 followers in the Shakahola Forest Massacre. Mackenzie and 90 other suspects pleaded not guilty. Prosecutors allege he incited followers to starve to 'meet Jesus,' with at least 420 witnesses prepared for the trial.
summary: The leader of a Kenyan starvation sect, Paul Nthenge Mackenzie, went on trial for manslaughter over the deaths of over 400 followers in the Shakahola Forest Massacre. Mackenzie and 90 other suspects pleaded not guilty. Prosecutors allege he incited followers to starve to 'meet Jesus,' with at least 420 witnesses prepared for the trial.
